materials.raw_text: Cd: 100 g, La: 25 g, Ni: 50 g, Tb: 35 g, Y: 10 g

sourcing.instructions: Cd: Specialty metal suppliers; La: Rare earth material suppliers; Ni: Industrial metal suppliers; Tb: Rare earth material suppliers; Y: Rare earth material suppliers
steps: Cd: Specialty metal suppliers; La: Rare earth material suppliers; Ni: Industrial metal suppliers; Tb: Rare earth material suppliers; Y: Rare earth material suppliers

1. Gather all materials and ensure they are in powdered form. 2. Measure each ingredient with a precision scale. 3. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the powders thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer until a uniform blend is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Gather all materials and ensure they are in powdered form. 2. Measure each ingredient with a precision scale. 3. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine the powders thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer until a uniform blend is achieved.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a suitable crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 3. Set the furnace to 1000°C and maintain for 2 hours to allow for proper mixing and reactions among the elements.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a suitable crucible. 2. Heat the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 3. Set the furnace to 1000°C and maintain for 2 hours to allow for proper mixing and reactions among the elements.

steps: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool to room temperature naturally. 2. This cooling process should take approximately 4-6 hours to prevent thermal shock to the sample.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After the heating duration, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool to room temperature naturally. 2. This cooling process should take approximately 4-6 hours to prevent thermal shock to the sample.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified material from the crucible. 2. Use a grinder or sanding tool to finish the surface to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solidified material from the crucible. 2. Use a grinder or sanding tool to finish the surface to the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to enhance durability.
